notes.text:
Don't skip the water bath - it ensures smooth custard
The custard should wobble slightly
Chill thoroughly before brûléeing

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by preheating the oven to 140°C. This will ensure our crème brûlée cooks evenly.

steps.descr: Heat cream with vanilla pod until just boiling

on_enter.say: Now, let's gently heat the cream with the vanilla pod until it's just about to boil. You'll smell that lovely vanilla aroma.

steps.instructions: Heat cream with vanilla pod until just boiling

steps.descr: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now whisk those egg yolks with the sugar until they're pale and creamy. This will give our custard a beautiful texture.

steps.instructions: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale

steps.descr: Pour hot cream over eggs, whisking constantly

on_enter.say: Carefully pour the hot cream over the egg mixture, whisking all the time. This is key to a smooth custard.

steps.instructions: Pour hot cream over eggs, whisking constantly

on_enter.say: Let's strain the mixture into the ramekins to catch any lumps. This will ensure a silky finish.

steps.descr: Bake in water bath for 30-35 minutes

on_enter.say: Time to bake! Place the ramekins in a water bath and pop them in the oven for 30 to 35 minutes. The custard should be set but still have a slight wobble.

steps.instructions: Bake in water bath for 30-35 minutes

steps.descr: Chill 4 hours, sprinkle with sugar and blowtorch

on_enter.say: Once baked, chill the custards for at least 4 hours. Then sprinkle with sugar and use a blowtorch to caramelize the top. Listen for that lovely crack when you tap it!

steps.instructions: Chill 4 hours, sprinkle with sugar and blowtorch

recipe.title: Crème Brûlée
recipe.description: Silky vanilla custard with caramelized sugar crust
